Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small jar with a rounded body, short and narrow neck and convex lip. The vase is well made, constructed from a rather fine clay, orange, common and carefully polished. A barely noticeable mark was incised near the shoulder after the firing process: two vertical lines, a sign that resembles an arch and a very large, coarsely carved cross.
